required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Follicular Fluid Raman Shifts and IVF Outcomes
clinical_study.official_title: The Correlation Between Follicular Fluid Raman Spectrum and Embryo Development in Infertile Patients With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: ShangHai Ji Ai Genetics & IVF Institute

clinical_study.source: ShangHai Ji Ai Genetics & IVF Institute

brief_summary.textblock: This study intends to collect about 150 cases of follicular fluid samples from PCOS and non-PCOS infertility patients undergoing in vitro fertilization (IVF) or intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) cycles (in clinical routines).We tend to detect Raman metabolic profile of the follicular fluid of the PCOS and non-PCOS groups, and find the correlation between the metabolic profile of the follicular fluid of PCOS patients and the oocyte quality, IVF outcome and subsequent embryo development are also under investigation. Metabolomics analysis was applied to look for markers of follicular fluid in PCOS patients, and further exploring data and strategies to improve the embryonic development potential and IVF outcome of PCOS patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference between polycystic ovary syndrome and normal follicular fluids
primary_outcome.description: Raman spectrum was applied and the Raman spectrum characteristic absorption peak can be revealed. PCA analysis was used to measure the degree of differential shifts.

intervention.description: The wavelength of the follicular fluids were scaned by Raman spectrum

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients fit the Rotterdam criteria for PCOS
- Patients under IVF cycles
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with male factors infertility
- Patients with fallopian tube factors infertility

facility.name: Shanghai JiAi Genetics and IVF Institute
